cookies.title: Cookies
text: This website has been created by your employer to raise awareness and knowledge related to privacy, and you will have the opportunity to participate in activities to test your knowledge and learn more about privacy.
Aggregate, non-identifiable data regarding participation and privacy knowledge will be shared with your employer to inform the privacy program.

Please note that, in cases of small teams or country operations, your employer may be able to identify you if less than five people have the same division or organizational unit, job function, and work country. Your employer will process the data consistent with its privacy policy and associate notice, including not intentionally identifying you and taking reasonable measures, as appropriate, to prevent identification.
Although this website will not ask you to enter data about yourself, it does use cookies for the following purposes:
1) Necessary cookies: necessary cookies enable basic functions like page navigation and access to secure areas of the website. This website cannot function properly without these cookies.<
2) Preferences: preference cookies enable this website to remember information that changes the way the website behaves or looks, like your preferred language or finished tasks or score.
3) Statistics: statistic cookies help to understand how you interact with this website by collecting and reporting information anonymously.

bedroom-letter: Welcome aboard! As the captain of this vessel, it is my job to protect your safety and your data privacy. Our privacy notice is printed on the back of your ticket, and to show our commitment to data privacy, I have asked Franklin to place information about our 5 data privacy principles in your cabin. He was supposed to leave them on the desk, but I have heard that his software is buggy, so you may need to search for them. I hope to meet you soon.
– Captain Maria

privacy-notice.title: Cruise Ship Privacy Notice
privacy-notice.description: We take your privacy very seriously. This notice sets forth what we collect, what we share, and your right. For more details, please see the captain.

table.title: The Personal information we collect and how we use it

content.description: We collect to identify and contact you, such as your name, gender nationality, date of birth, mailing adress, email adress, telephone number, and passport information (such as passport number and expiration date). This information may be shared with employees of the ship to facilitate your voyage.

As a high-tech cruise line, we employ state-of-the-art technology and algorithms to offer you the best voyage possible. To do this, we may use cameras and other sensors to track your movement on the ship, how long you stay in various rooms,and how you interact with our employees and other passengers.
Information which you give us to execute the payment. Usually, this means the payment card details.

we are committed to ensuring you have a safe voyage! We will ask you to let us know if you have any food allergies, and we also have a nurse on staff in the event of sea-sickness or other ailment. If you visit the nurse, we may collect infor-mation about any current or prior health conditions. This information will only be used by cruise employees for the purposes of ensuring your safety.
You have the right to request a copy of all Personal Information collected about you and to ask us to collect or delete that information. To exercice these rights, please contact Captain Maria

msgs.text: I'm Maria, Capitan of the ship

No – I am concerned about my privacy – my dietary restrictions were shared with other guests without my permission, my passport photo was used for biometric facial recognition without my permission, and more! I thought you cared about privacy – how can you let this happen?
Oh goodness – I’m afraid that Franklin may have messed things up – after all, he is an AI-powered robot, and he does not have the judgment of a human.
That’s not an excuse. I can contact a regulator and report these violations! I have privacy rights – I demand that you share with me what personal information you have about me.
That’s not necessary – you don’t have privacy rights
We need to protect our guests – if we don’t, we could cause them harm – and if they file a complaint with the regulator, the fines and bad press could literally sink our business.
You do have privacy rights, and I will give you a copy of your data so you can see what we have collected, and if anything needs to be corrected or deleted, you can make a follow-up request.
As for you Franklin, I think we need to update your software!
Thank you for bringing the privacy issues aboard to my attention!
Your commitment to responsible data use is admirable, and I’d like to offer you a complimentary return voyage
I promise we will work out the kinks in our systems before then!
In the meantime, here is the URL you can use when you return to shore to share your feedback about this cruise and enter your country in the privacy day competition.
Privacy Day Competition URL
